pageContext.claim: “Our framework generously offers a path to citizenship for 1.8 million illegal immigrants who were brought here by their parents at a young age. That covers almost three times more people than the previous administration covered.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an apples-and-orange comparison. Trump is comparing the number of people who are currently enrolled under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program with the number theoretically covered under Trump's plan. But the White House has not explained how it calculated the 1.8 million figure, or what the qualifications would be, while Obama had sought to expand the program until it was blocked by the courts.
